duties_responsibilities.duty: Manage a team of engineers and designers, and serve as a technical specialist in formulating and developing advanced concepts, techniques, and standards.
Supervise and manage the process engineering department, including planning, coordinating, executing, and monitoring all activities.
Review the work and performance of process engineering department personnel to ensure accuracy, quality, and timeliness of project and process requirements.
Perform conceptual, preliminary, and detailed process design as needed.
Lead in planning, workhour estimates, cost development and management, and scheduling for assigned projects.
Coordinate process engineering department personnel to ensure business unit and overall company priorities are addressed in a timely manner.
Ensure client inputs and project requirements are adequately addressed and implemented consistently with contractual requirements.
Provide technical leadership and process engineering expertise for the company.
Support sales and marketing effort and work closely with business development on proposals and presentations.
Interact with project managers to verify project designs are accurate and meet the intended scope.
Maintain effective communication with project team members and with the customer.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor's degree in Chemical Engineering or technical field from an accredited college or University. Master’s Degree preferred. P.E. License preferred.
